cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 160 miles SE of Nantucket, Massachusetts
cyclone.trajectory: continuing northeast toward Nova Scotia and Newfoundland

weather_observation.watch_coast: Woods Hole MA to Sagamore Beach MA, Nantucket & Martha's Vineyard, east of Bar Harbor ME to Eastport ME, Prince Edward Island, southwest Nova Scotia, Fundy National Park to Shediac, and portions of Newfoundland & Labrador
weather_observation.warning_coast: Eastern Nova Scotia from Lower East Pubnico to Brule and western Newfoundland from Indian Harbour to Hawke's Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeastern New England coast northward to Atlantic Canada
weather_observation.wind: Only indirect effects such as increased swells and occasional gusty outer‐band showers were possible earlier in the week; no strong winds expected now.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at this time for the Georgia coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: No heavy rainfall expected; most rainfall is confined to New England and Atlantic Canada.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated surf and rip currents may linger along the southeastern U.S. coast for another 12–24 h, which can affect pilot boarding operations.
